content.rendered:
Registration is now open for our December Market Briefing Webinar for maritime and insurance professionals. Join our experts who will look at semi-submersible and Heavy Lift ships, focusing on design features, uses and risk factors.

The webinar is scheduled for Thursday 10th December at 1500hrs GMT.

A semi-submersible Heavy Lift vessel in operation is not a common site but these vessels carry out some of the most fascinating operations in the transport of big, heavy, and expensive cargos. The webinar will give an overview of the various types of semi-submersible float on float off “flo-flo” and lift on-lift off “Lo-Lo” Heavy Lift ships, and a close look at a niche market of designated yacht transport vessels.

The presentation will cover the general designs in use and the specific features they bring, and will cover some of the projects and cargoes these vessels are used for. We will look at the particular risks involved for the vessel, crew, and transported cargo and how this risk is mitigated.

Long-standing Principal Surveyor Frank Vandelft, based in the USA, will present the technical subject.

The session chairman will be John Walker, Managing Director of Marine in the USA, and the month’s casualty reports will be presented by surveyor Fena Boyle from our London office.

If you wish to attend this webinar, click here to register.

excerpt.rendered: Registration is now open for our December Market Briefing Webinar for maritime and insurance professionals. Join our experts who will look at semi-submersible and Heavy Lift ships, focusing on design features, uses and risk factors.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: October Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Registration is now open for our October Market Briefing Webinar for maritime and insurance professionals. Join our experts who will look at the challenges arising from the Covid-19 pandemic and the consequences it has had for marine warranty surveys on current and future projects. The webinar is scheduled for Thursday…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar - July Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register for our July Market Briefing for the maritime and maritime insurance sectors, our experts will be presenting on shiprepair & shipbuilding in Turkey, specifically the development of the shipyards in the Tuzla and Yalova area.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Marine Casualty Market Briefing Webinar - Vessel Lay-up and Reactivation
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Join AqualisBraemar Marine experts for our Market Briefing webinar at 3:30pm GMT on Thursday 9th April 2020.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: September Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register now for our September Market Briefing Webinar for maritime & insurance professionals and join our experts who will be detailing first-hand experiences of our findings during ‘Shipshape©’ Risk Assessment Surveys.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: August Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register now for our August Market Briefing Webinar for maritime & insurance professionals and join our experts who will be discussing the current status of the Salvage Market and new developments in this sector.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Carnival Vista docking and repair
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: July 19, 2019 AqualisBraemar were recently involved in the successful float-on of the 133,596 GT cruise ship Carnival Vista onto the Boka Vanguard, the largest semi-sub heavy-lift ship of its type in the world.
